practice_cycles.short_explanation: I'm going to focus on the core skeleton of a web app. I'll get comfortable mapping URLs to Python code and rendering data onto a page without worrying about a database yet.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Building a multi-page informational site using dynamic URL routing and template inheritance.
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Practicing Python decorator syntax to understand how @app.route actually works.

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Creating static routes and returning simple HTML strings.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Passing complex nested dictionaries to templates and using Jinja2 macros to reduce code repetition.

objective: Local server handles 10+ unique routes without errors.
Templates use base.html inheritance for all views.
subjective: The flow from browser request to Flask function feels intuitive.
Less time spent looking up basic Jinja2 syntax for loops.

practice_cycles.short_explanation: Now I'll make the app stateful. I'll spend my time connecting a database and building forms that allow users to actually input and save data.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Building a CRUD application (like a micro-blog or task list) using Flask-SQLAlchemy and WTForms.
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Handling database migrations using Flask-Migrate to manage schema changes.

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Defining a simple database model with one or two fields.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Implementing one-to-many relationships and handling POST request validation errors gracefully.

objective: Application successfully saves, retrieves, and updates records in a SQLite database.
Form validation prevents empty or malformed submissions.
subjective: Confidence in managing database models without manual SQL commands.

practice_cycles.short_explanation: I'm going to scale the app and secure it. I'll reorganize the code into Blueprints and add user login features to reach that intermediate level.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Refactoring a project into the Application Factory pattern and adding Flask-Login for session management.
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Implementing password hashing and protected routes using decorators.

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Using a single file for all routes.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Correctly implementing circular-dependency-free Blueprints and managing user session state.

objective: Application structure follows the Blueprint pattern across multiple files.
Implementation of a working 'Login/Logout' system with restricted page access.
subjective: The project feels professional and scalable rather than a 'script'.
I feel capable of starting a new project from scratch without a tutorial.

objective: Number of functional features implemented per 10-hour block.
Percentage of code adhering to the Application Factory pattern.
Time taken to debug a database connection or routing error.
subjective: Self-rated level of 'lostness' when error logs appear in the terminal.
Confidence in explaining the difference between a request context and an app context.
Perceived cleanliness and modularity of the project structure.

architect_notes: I'm prioritizing Flask-SQLAlchemy over raw SQL because the abstraction helps focus on the framework logic first.
The shift to Blueprints in Cycle 3 is a major hurdle; I should expect a dip in productivity during that transition.
10 hours a week is enough to build three distinct small projects, which is better for mastery than one giant project that gets too messy.

details.reason: User initiated a new learning session.

timeline.title: Initial Practice Strategy Created
timeline.summary: Initial practice strategy created for ['Learn C++ Programming'].

details.reason: Sufficient information provided to create initial practice system.

timeline.title: Initial Practice Strategy Created
timeline.summary: Initial practice strategy created for ['Learn Python Flask'].

constraints.dropout_risk: Complexity fatigue during environment configuration and database migrations

dropout_risk (inferred from common friction points in Flask development)
